{{set index}}

The term '''mineral''' refers to all items that can be crafted into [[mineral blocks]]. Most of these can also be used as [[Smithing|armor trim]] materials.
* {{ItemLink|id=Amethyst Shard|Amethyst}} – the [[Overworld]] variety of [[quartz]] found in {{EnvLink|amethyst geode|amethyst geodes}}
* {{ItemLink|id=Resin Clump|Resin}} – a hard organic material produced by [[creaking heart]]s
* [[Ore]] minerals:
** {{ItemLink|id=Copper Ingot|Copper}} – electrically conductive [[metal]] that can [[oxidize]]
** {{ItemLink|id=Diamond|Diamond family|Diamond}} – very hard crystal made of pure carbon
** {{ItemLink|id=Emerald|Emerald family|Emerald}} – precious gemstone found in [[mountain]]s
** {{ItemLink|id=Gold Ingot|Gold}} – soft, precious metal
** {{ItemLink|id=Iron Ingot|Iron}} – hard, durable metal
** {{ItemLink|Lapis Lazuli}} – used for [[enchanting]]
** {{ItemLink|id=Coal|Coal family|Coal}} – a [[fuel]]

=== Fictitious minerals ===
While the materials that make up this list are unique to ''[[Minecraft]]'', either their names directly imply they're minerals or they may be commonly perceived as such. Their actual nature is up to one's own imagination.
* {{ItemLink|Glowstone Dust|Glowstone}} – brittle, glowing material from [[the Nether]]
* {{ItemLink|Netherite Scrap|Netherite}} – rare, super-hard material that can't be destroyed in [[lava]]; found only in the Nether
* {{ItemLink|Nether Quartz}} – the Nether variety of quartz used as an ornamental block and as an ingredient for some redstone components
* {{ItemLink|Prismarine Crystals}} – rare building material found in [[Monument]]s
* {{ItemLink|Redstone Dust|Redstone}} – material that can carry signals and activate moving parts
